actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Saturday, September 30, 2023,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Saturday, September 30, 2023, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 156 (Sen. Peters):
        A resolution calling on the Government of the Russian Federation to release United States citizen Paul Whelan.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 394 (Sen. Schumer):
        A resolution honoring the life of James L. Buckley , former Senator for the State of New York.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN676:
        James C. O'Brien, of Nebraska, to be an Assistant Secretary of State (European and Eurasian Affairs)

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 63 - 32. Record Vote Number: 248 


        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate 10/04/2023.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Reed, at  7:12 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
